item.title: Linux常用命令和vi
item.description: Startup process in Linux Stage1 Hardware boot POST + BIOS Stage2 BootLoader Stage3 Kernel boot Stage4 Sys init Process init is the starting point for all processes on the system. /etc/inittab Determine the run level in system(0-6). Run Level Change run level : init n ,n=0,1,3,5,6 （init 0 means shutdown without syn, 6 means reboot） Change the default run level

item.title: Oracle Linux Installation
item.description: Overview of Linux GNU/Linux (Linux kernel + GNU suite), UNIX-like OS. Compared with Windows, it has the advantages of stable system performance, speed and security. Commonly used in servers, embedded systems, network firewalls and so on. Because of its open source, powerful network functions, the system tool chain is complete and popular. img Common versions: RHEL, Oracle Linux, CentOS, Ubuntu, Debian, SUSE, archlinux and so on.
